alert.note: Alert for Brown; Coleman; McCulloch; San Saba (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 11:58PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Brown, southeastern Coleman, northeastern McCulloch and northern San Saba Counties through 1245 AM CDT... At 1158 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Zephyr to near Brookesmith. Movement was southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brownwood, San Saba, Early, Santa Anna, Richland Springs, Algerita, Bangs, Blanket, Lake Brownwood Near Thrifty, Sloan, Zephyr, Brookesmith, Lake Brownwood State Park, Skeeterville, Elm Grove, Lake Brownwood, Winchell, Camp Bowie, Trickham and Placid. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for west central Texas.
